author: LA NACION
title: La desoladora imagen de un caballo atrapado en un techo de una vivienda tapada por agua - LA NACION
text:
En medio de la dramática situación que se vive en el sur de Brasil, donde las inundaciones ya dejaron más de 100 muertos y millones de damnificados, las imágenes de la catástrofe climática dan cuenta de la trágica situación que azota a miles de personas y animales. Tal es el caso, de un caballo que quedó atrapado en un techo de una vivienda tapada por el agua y afortunadamente logró ser rescatado este jueves, según pudo verse en un video publicado por la señal de noticias brasileña Globo News. El rescate a cargo del Departamento de Bomberos de San Pablo generó gran repercusión luego que se viralizara en las últimas horas un desolador video difundido por Globo News, retratando una escena que se replica en varios estados del sur de Brasil.
Las imágenes son más que elocuentes. Desde un helicóptero, las cámaras lograron captar la imagen aérea de la región de Canoas, en Rio Grande do Sul, una de los estados más afectados por las incesantes lluvias, en la que puede verse desde arriba como un caballo intenta hacer equilibrio sobre el techo de una vivienda prácticamente tomada por el agua.

author: Karen Renee Nogoy Pacific Daily News
title: Hike of ‘sacrifice’: Hundreds climb Mt. Jumullong-Manglo to observe Good Friday | News | guampdn.com
text: Hundreds of Catholic faithful began their days bright and early with a Stations of the Cross hike at 1,283-feet Mount Jumullong-Manglo to commemorate Good Friday, the day marking the passion, crucifixion, and death of Jesus Christ. Many hikers set out early as the roadside parking spaces began to fill up quickly with cars. Around 5:30 a.m., a few of the hikers who began the trek way before dawn were already heading back down the mountain. The trail this year was a bit slippery from the previous day’s weather, but it was better than last year, according to regular Good Friday hikers, because of the absence of rain. Yigo resident Jerome Naldoza, who came with his family all the way down south for the Good Friday hike, mentioned it was his first time this year, but his wife had encountered the rainy and muddy conditions during last year’s hike. “It’s not that really difficult because my wife told me the last time she came here, it was raining but this time, at least, it’s good weather,” Naldoza said. Some noted, however, the trails are narrower this year, which made the hiking experience more challenging. “It used to be wider. They changed the route. So, it’s kind of more dangerous because everybody’s going through,” said Jasmine Ayuyu, 14, a resident from Chalan Pago. Ayuyu, who has been hiking every Good Friday since when she was nine, said she finds joy in expressing her faith through prayers at the stations while engaging in physical exercise. For first timer Maria Santo Tomas, 58, from Mongmong, the most difficult trails were the ones right at the beginning and towards the end. "I almost died, I almost passed out, I almost gave up,” she jokingly said. “I guess because I kind of don’t exercise, that’s why I almost passed out.” Red ribbons were tied on tree branches or grass to signal potential hazards, such as holes on the ground, to ensure the safety of trekkers. There were 14 markers representing the Stations of the Cross, which indicate the final steps of Jesus Christ, for Catholics to pray and reflect on his suffering and sacrifice. There were also a few large crosses placed at certain areas of the mountain, bearing people’s names in remembrance of their passing. Giant cross Apart from the 14 stations, the hike includes the annual tradition of placing one giant cross at the summit of the mountain. Which is why, upon reaching the mountain top, people are greeted with a row of large wooden crosses planted over the past years. Every Lenten season, the Cruz family of Mongmong installs a cross on the lawn of Nuestra Señora de las Aguas Church and then carries it up to the mountain on Good Friday. Gregorio Cruz described his family’s tradition, which has evolved into a community practice, as a form of “sacrifice.” “To sacrifice for what Jesus Christ went through, to go and act on, and to feel what he went through during his time that he bared the cross,” he said. Cruz noted the significance of this reenactment of carrying the cross in ensuring that the younger generation understands the story of Jesus Christ’s life and strengthen their faith. “If we don’t reenact, then the children and a lot of other people would not know. So, everyone coming up here to experience what Jesus had gone through would have the idea of why we do this every year,” said Cruz. Cruz also hoped to uphold this tradition for the next decades. Charlie Cruz-Camacho, a member of the Cruz family, also views this as a sacrificial gesture to remember Jesus Christ’s suffering. “God suffered more than we have, and we can’t repay him in any way, but this is at least something that we can do to kind of remember him and what he’s been through,” Cruz-Camacho said. Meanwhile, for Dennis Geron, a construction worker living in Tamuning, the annual hike, which was his third time already this year, was an act of penance. Annual trekkers like Jaeleen Leon Guerrero of Chalan Pago, urged those who haven’t experienced the Good Friday hike to give it a try at least once in their lifetime, and bring their families along, especially the children. “I think everybody should try it at least once in their life. It’s a good experience. Take the kids. Good to start them young and have it a yearly thing,” said Leon Guerrero.

author: Redação
title: Mariana Rios se emociona ao falar sobre tratamento de fertilidade
text:
Mariana Rios se emociona ao falar sobre tratamento de fertilidade
Atriz revelou ter recebido difíceis notícias do médico e compartilhou momento de vulnerabilidade com os fãs
Mariana Rios comoveu os seguidores ao surgir chorando em seus stories nesta quarta-feira (23), após receber uma notícia difícil sobre seu tratamento para engravidar. Em meio às gravações da nova temporada de seu documentário "Basta Sentir Maternidade", a atriz revelou que esperava iniciar essa fase com boas notícias, mas precisou lidar com mais um desafio em sua jornada.
"Para tudo aquilo que foge ao nosso entendimento, existe apenas uma palavra: aceitação", desabafou. Mariana foi diagnosticada recentemente com trombofilia adquirida, uma condição que pode impactar diretamente a fertilidade. Mesmo sem entrar em detalhes sobre o conteúdo da ligação com o médico, o estado emocional da artista deixou claro que o processo sofreu algum revés.
+ Andressa Suita quebra o silêncio e nega nova gravidez: "Só comi demais"
+ Simone e Simaria cantam juntas e fãs piram com possível retorno da dupla
A atriz explicou que havia conseguido um bom número de embriões, o que aumentava sua expectativa por uma fase positiva no tratamento. "Hoje eu vou me dar o direito de ficar assim, mas amanhã eu vou acordar melhor", disse ela, entre lágrimas, mostrando força e vulnerabilidade ao mesmo tempo. Mariana segue compartilhando sua história com o público, inspirando outras mulheres que enfrentam o mesmo caminho.
Assista:

author: @le_parisien
title: Suède : l’émigration plus importante que l’immigration, une première en 50 ans
text:
Suède : l’émigration plus importante que l’immigration, une première en 50 ans
Sur les cinq premiers mois de 2024, l’émigration a été plus importante que l’immigration dans le pays scandinave dirigé par un gouvernement conservateur soutenu par l’extrême droite.
2024 devrait marquer une rupture démographique en Suède, dans ce pays qui fut longtemps considéré comme une terre d’accueil pour les migrants. Le nombre de personnes quittant le pays scandinave devrait dépasser le nombre d’immigrés, une première depuis plus d’un demi-siècle, a annoncé jeudi le
gouvernement conservateur soutenu par l’extrême droite.
D’après les chiffres préliminaires de l’institut statistique national, sur les cinq premiers mois de l’année, l’émigration a été plus importante que l’immigration dans le pays scandinave, une tendance qui devrait se poursuivre, a indiqué la ministre des Migrations Maria Malmer Stenergard. Elle a publié sur le réseau social X, les chiffres de l’immigration depuis 2014… et de l’émigration pour ce début d’année.
Les demandes d’asile continuent en parallèle de diminuer et ont atteint leur niveau le plus bas depuis 1997, a-t-elle ajouté. « Les efforts du gouvernement portent leurs fruits (…). Cette tendance à l’immigration soutenable est essentielle si nous voulons renforcer l’intégration et réduire l’exclusion », a fait valoir la ministre.
En outre, « l’émigration a augmenté parmi les personnes nées dans des pays tels que l’
Irak, la Somalie et la Syrie », a-t-elle poursuivi. Le pays avait accueilli un grand nombre d’immigrants depuis les années 1990, principalement en provenance de régions en proie à des conflits, notamment l’ ex-Yougoslavie, l’ Afghanistan et les trois pays cités par la ministre.
Le chef de file des conservateurs Ulf Kristersson a accédé au pouvoir en octobre 2022, en formant un bloc majoritaire avec l’appui du parti nationaliste des
Démocrates de Suède. Il s’était engagé à réduire drastiquement l’immigration.
Ce parti, arrivé en deuxième position aux
 législatives de 2022, n’a pas eu les résultats qu’il escomptait aux élections européennes de ce printemps avec 13,9 % des voix, derrière les écologistes.
